intro: Gymnanthemum wightianum, commonly known as the Indian whiteflower, is a flowering plant native to the Indian subcontinent. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, white, five-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and has simple, opposite leaves. It is often found in forests and along stream banks. Gymnanthemum wightianum is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
